wikipedia_page.main: Peter Ian Burgoyne (born 11 November 1993 in Nottingham) is an English cricketer who plays for Derbyshire County Cricket Club. An all-rounder, he bowls right-arm off spin, and bats right-handed. He made his debut for the county in the 2011 Clydesdale Bank 40 against Middlesex in August 2011.

response: Burgoyne is of Indigenous Australian descent with tribal ancestry that can be traced to the Kokatha (Nunga) in South Australia.AFL Record. Round 9,2009. Slattery Publishing. pg 75. He grew up in the Northern Territory and began playing football with St Mary's in the Northern Territory Football League (NTFL). He is the elder brother of former Hawthorn and Port Adelaide player, Shaun Burgoyne and is the son of former Port Adelaide player Peter Burgoyne, Snr.
